Class Theater

  • java.lang.Object
    • Theater

  • public class Theater
extends java.lang.Object
    Purpose: Data Structure and Algorithms Project Status: Complete and thoroughly tested Last update: 4/20/19 Submitted: 04/30/19 Comment: test suite and sample run attached

    @author: Christina Bannon, Elvin Torres

    @version: 4.20.2019

    Theater

    • Simulates a single theater playing a single show.
    • Holds manipulates & returns data regarding:
      1. Seating - whether a party can be seated or not, and where they will sit.
      2. Name of movie being played.
      3. Tickets sold for the show
      4. Whether a customer of the same name is already seated in the Theater or not

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Theater(int rows, int cols, java.lang.String movieName)
      Theater constructor initializes private variables to the user input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean assignSeats(Customer customer)
      assignSeats accepts a customer, and if there are seats available for the individuals in the customer's party, 'seats' the customers by passing the customer object to the seatingHelper
      java.lang.String getMovieName()
      getMovieName returns the user input name of the movie
      int getTicketsSold()
      getTicketsSold returns the accumulator of tickets sold for a particular movie
      boolean hasEnoughSeats(int partySize)
      Checks if there is enough seats for the given size of party.
      boolean hasName(java.lang.String name)
      accepts a String name, checks the seatChart array for the name, and returns a boolean indicating whether the name is present in the theater
      boolean isEmpty()
      isEmpty returns a boolean to describe whether the theater is empty or not
      boolean removeCustomer(java.lang.String name)
      removeCustomer accepts a name, searches the seatChart array for the name, sets every elements of the array equal to the string to null and returns a boolean that represents whether the name was present in the array or not.
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString creates a String that represents the seatChart array in the form of a row x col seating chart
